Package cen3024c

Class WordOccurrences

java.lang.Object
cen3024c.WordOccurrences
public class WordOccurrences extends Object
This class is a modification of the CEN 3024C SDLC Assignment for the CEN3024C UI Design Assignment. Usage: readText > convertArrayListToHashMap > sortHashMap > convertHashMapToString
Version:
07/07/2022
Author:
Stephen Sturges Jr

  • Constructor Details

    • WordOccurrences

      public WordOccurrences()

  • Method Details

    • convertArrayListToHashMap

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> convertArrayListToHashMap(ArrayList<String> inputText)
      Loops through the ArrayList, counts the number of occurrences of each word, and outputs a HashMap containing each word and its number of occurrences.
      Parameters:
      inputText - An ArrayList of Strings. Each string is a line of text from the readText method.
      Returns:
      HashMap containing (word, number of occurrences) pairs.

    • convertHashMapToString

      public static String convertHashMapToString(HashMap<String,Integer> inputText)
      Converts a sorted HashMap into Strings ending in a new line character for display.
      Parameters:
      inputText - A HashMap containing a word and its number of occurrences.
      Returns:
      String in the format: "#. word, number_of_occurrences"

    • readText

      public static ArrayList<String> readText(String inputURL, String startText, String endText)
      Reads the text from a webpage.
      Parameters:
      inputURL - The URL of the webpage you wish to extract text from.
      startText - The first line of the text you want to extract.
      endText - The line after the last line you want to extract.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of lower case strings.

    • sortHashMap

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> sortHashMap(HashMap<String,Integer> inputText)
      Sorts the values stored in a HashMap according to the integer value, greatest to least.
      Parameters:
      inputText - HashMap with String keys and Integer values containing a word and its number of occurrences.
      Returns:
      Sorted HashMap of words from highest occurrence to lowest.
